messages.title: Important, practical information about voting in the General Election
messages.content: Jim Fitzpatrick emphasizes the importance of making wise choices for the community in the upcoming General Election and expresses his belief that he has acted in the best interests of Poplar & Limehouse residents for the last 13 years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jim Fitzpatrick discusses his hands-on efforts to address social behaviour issues by holding coffee mornings with the Neighbourhood Police Teams, highlighting the Labour Party's work in providing extra funding for such initiatives.

He comments on the failing banks, businesses, and public services under the Tory government and highlights his opposition to their cutbacks and privatization efforts, vowing to work toward a recovery.

issues.economy: Addresses economic problems caused by the Tories, advocating for recovery to help failing banks, businesses, and public services.
issues.governance: Discusses governance in relation to policing and economic management.

leaflet.personalStatement: Expresses a desire to continue working to make Poplar & Limehouse a better place to live and mentions his belief in acting in the best interests of the residents.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Poplar & Limehouse
politicalExperience.achievements: Listening closely to people in Poplar & Limehouse and acting on social behaviour issues with the Neighbourhood Police Teams.

images.caption: Jim Fitzpatrick with a background of police officers and community members.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains a PS mentioning that the same form for voting from home covers both the General Election and the Tower Hamlets Council elections.
